lines.content: This is a project for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
todo **[description]** | Adds a todo task with description
deadline **[description]** /by **[deadline time]** | Adds a deadline task with description and deadline
event **[description]** /at **[event time]** | Adds an event task with description and event time
done **[index]** | Mark index of task as done
find **[keyword]** | Find the specified keyword from the list of tasks
list | Display the current list of tasks
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
* @param filePath file path of the stored data
* Add deadline task to task list
* Add event task to task list
* Add todo task to task list
/** Represents the command to be executed from the user */
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + removedTask.toString());
System.out.println("Please enter index of task to be removed");
System.out.println("Please enter index within range 1 to " + taskList.getTasks().size());
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + task);
System.out.println("Please enter index of task done");
System.out.println("Please enter index within range 1 to " + taskList.getTasks().size());
* Find list of tasks with matching words
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Please enter keyword of task to search");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
/** Represents the parser that parses commands input from the user */
* Parse the correct command based on the different command type
* @throws DukeException handles the duke exception error
public static void processUserInput(CommandType commandType, String userInput,
LIST, BYE, DONE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, NULL
* Determines the type of command the user entered
* Marks status of task to done when parsing txt file.
* Check for errors in input by user
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Check for errors in input by user
throw new DukeException("The description of a deadline task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The deadline time of the deadline task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The description or dateline time cannot be empty.");
* Check for errors in input by user
throw new DukeException("The description of a event task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The event time of the event task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The description or dateline time cannot be empty.");
/** Represents user interfaces between duke and user */
/** Prints the welcome message at start of program. */
System.out.println("Hello I'm Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
/** Prints the exit message at end of program. */
/** Prints error message to inform user about invalid input. */
System.out.println("User command is not valid, please try again!");
* Prints message to inform user task is added successfully.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + taskList.getTasks().get(lastTaskIndex));
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list");
/** Prints message to inform user no matching task with given keyword */
System.out.println("No tasks found with given keyword. Please try again!");
* Prints the list of task specified
* If the file "duke.txt" exists, reads the file.
* If the file "duke.txt" does not exist, creates the file.
System.out.println("IO exception error unable to create file " + filePath);
* Reads the content of the saved file.
* @return List of task from the txt file.
throw new DukeException("Unable to parse file: " + filePath);
System.out.println("Unable to parse line " + (numTaskAdded + 1) + " of " + filePath);
System.out.println("IO exception error when loading data " + filePath);
